feedback_items.title: Replace 'X' icon with 'More Options' and Add Undo for 'Hide Post'
feedback_items.why_it_matters: Users might accidentally hide content permanently, leading to frustration and perceived lack of control over their feed.
implementation_steps: Replace the current 'X' icon component (e.g., `IconButton` in Flutter, `Button` with SVG in React Native) with a '...' (ellipsis/kebab menu) icon.
Implement a modal bottom sheet or dropdown menu that appears upon tapping the '...' icon.
Populate this menu with clear, labeled options such as 'Hide post', 'Report post', 'Save post'.
When 'Hide post' is selected, trigger the appropriate API call to hide the content and immediately display a temporary `Snackbar` or `Toast` message at the bottom of the screen with an 'Undo' action.
If 'Undo' is tapped, revert the API call (if applicable) and re-display the post. Ensure the undo mechanism is robust for network latency.
The 'Undo' notification should be visible for a reasonable duration (e.g., 5-7 seconds) before disappearing.
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show '...' icon replacing 'X' in the post header. Illustrate the 'More Options' menu opening on tap. Show a temporary 'Snackbar' at the bottom of the screen reading 'Post hidden. Undo' after a post is hidden.
feedback_items.technical_notes: For Flutter, use `PopupMenuButton` or `showModalBottomSheet` for the menu, and `ScaffoldMessenger.of(context).showSnackBar()` for the 'Undo' toast. Ensure backend API supports 'hide' and 'unhide' actions.

feedback_items.title: Ensure Full Visibility of 'See More' Button in Feed Posts
feedback_items.why_it_matters: Users may struggle to read the full post or interact with the 'See More' button, leading to a fragmented content experience and potential accessibility issues.
implementation_steps: Review the layout container (e.g., `Column`, `Flex`) wrapping the post text and the 'See More' button.
Increase the vertical `padding` or `margin` below the truncated text and around the 'See More' button to prevent clipping.
Verify `maxLines` property of the text widget and ensure it's not truncating too aggressively or without enough buffer for the button.
Test across various device screen sizes and text scaling settings to ensure responsive display and prevent future truncation issues.
Ensure the 'See More' button's touch target is at least 48x48dp, even if its visual size is smaller.
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show the main post text block with the 'See More' button ('‡∂≠‡∑Ä') fully visible and clearly separated from the bottom edge of the post card and the text itself, with ample whitespace.
affected_components: label (main text content of the post)
button (expands truncated post text to 'See More')
feedback_items.technical_notes: Adjust `Padding` or `SizedBox` in Flutter. For web/React Native, check CSS `padding`, `margin`, `min-height` on the containing elements. Avoid using `overflow: hidden` on the container if it's contributing to clipping.

feedback_items.title: Add Reaction Counts and Tappable Area to Post Emojis
feedback_items.why_it_matters: Users might miss opportunities to engage with posts or misunderstand the purpose of the displayed emojis, relying on recall rather than clear visual cues.
implementation_steps: Modify the backend API endpoint for feed posts to include aggregated counts for each reaction type (e.g., `{'ü•∫': 5, '‚ù§Ô∏è': 10}`).
On the frontend, fetch and display these numerical counts immediately adjacent to their corresponding emoji (e.g., 'ü•∫ 5', '‚ù§Ô∏è 10').
Wrap the entire reaction display area (emojis + counts) in a `GestureDetector` (Flutter) or similar tappable component.
Implement a navigation action on tap: either open a bottom sheet/modal displaying users who reacted, or display a reaction picker for the current user to add/change their reaction.
Ensure the combined tappable area meets minimum touch target guidelines (e.g., 48x48dp).
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show numerical counts next to each reaction emoji (e.g., 'ü•∫ 5', '‚ù§Ô∏è 10'). Indicate that this entire area is interactive and leads to a reaction details view or picker.
feedback_items.technical_notes: Requires backend modification. Frontend will use `Text` widgets for counts and `InkWell` or `GestureDetector` for interaction. Consider `ModalBottomSheet` for reaction details.

feedback_items.title: Optimize Spacing and Visual Weight in Top-Right Header Icons
feedback_items.why_it_matters: Users might feel overwhelmed by the number of interactive elements, potentially increasing cognitive load and hindering quick scanning for specific actions.
implementation_steps: Increase the horizontal `padding` or `margin` between the 'Create post/story', 'Search', and 'Messenger' icons in the top-right header.
Ensure the Messenger notification badge is clearly associated with its icon but does not cause visual overlap or interfere with the icon's touch target.
Verify that all header icons maintain a minimum touch target size of 48x48dp.
Review icon design: consider using outline icons for less critical actions to reduce visual weight, while maintaining clarity and platform conventions.
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show the top-right header icons ('Create', 'Search', 'Messenger') with more generous and consistent horizontal spacing between them. Ensure the Messenger badge is distinct and doesn't clutter the icon.
feedback_items.technical_notes: Adjust `SizedBox` widths or `Padding` in Flutter/React Native. For web, use CSS `gap` or `margin` properties within a Flexbox container for the icons. Ensure icon assets are consistent in style.

feedback_items.title: Implement Loading Indicators for Post Creation and Feed Scrolling
feedback_items.why_it_matters: Users may experience anxiety or uncertainty, wonder if their input was received, or mistakenly perform actions multiple times due to a lack of system feedback.
implementation_steps: **For Post Creation (from 'What's on your mind?' and 'create post/story' icon):**

When post creation is initiated (e.g., tapping the 'What's on your mind?' text input or the 'create post/story' icon), display a skeleton screen or a clear loading state for the post creation modal/screen.
When the 'Post'/'Share' button within the creation flow is tapped, disable the button and replace its text with a `CircularProgressIndicator` or similar spinner.
Upon successful post submission, display a temporary `Snackbar` or `Toast` message (e.g., 'Post shared successfully!').
**For Feed Loading (e.g., 'load more' content):**

When a user scrolls to the end of the feed and more content is being fetched, display a small `LinearProgressIndicator` at the bottom of the feed or a subtle spinner icon in the center indicating content is loading.
Consider implementing skeleton loading for newly fetched feed items as they populate the screen, providing a smoother perceived performance.
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show a loading spinner on the 'Post' button during submission. Show a 'Post shared!' `Snackbar` on success. Illustrate a small loading indicator at the bottom of the feed when scrolling to load more content.
affected_components: list_item (represents a single feed post, for 'load more' scenarios)
feedback_items.technical_notes: Requires robust state management (e.g., BLoC, Provider in Flutter; Redux, Context API in React Native) to track loading states. Use `CircularProgressIndicator`, `LinearProgressIndicator`, or custom skeleton widgets. `ScaffoldMessenger` for SnackBar feedback.

feedback_items.title: Remove Redundant Profile Picture from Post Image Overlay
feedback_items.why_it_matters: This adds minor visual clutter and unnecessary repetition, which can slightly detract from the overall clean aesthetic and potentially confuse screen reader users.
implementation_steps: Identify the UI component (e.g., `Image` widget, `` tag with absolute positioning) that renders the small profile picture in the bottom-right corner of the main post image.
Remove this component from the post's layout.
Verify that the post author's identity is still clearly and sufficiently communicated by their profile picture and name in the post header area.
feedback_items.wireframe_instructions: Show the main post image content without the small, overlaid profile picture in its bottom-right corner. The post header should still clearly display the author's profile picture and name.
affected_components: image (redundant profile picture of post author inside image)
feedback_items.technical_notes: This should be a straightforward removal of a single UI element. Ensure no side effects are introduced, like layout shifts or broken references.
